meanings.definition: The quality or state of being a laggard.
meanings.sent1: Her laggardnesses in completing tasks often caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent2: The team's laggardnesses in responding to emails led to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent3: Despite her laggardnesses, she always managed to catch up and deliver quality work.
meanings.sent4: The laggardnesses of the tortoise in the race surprised everyone when it won in the end.
meanings.sent5: The laggardnesses of the snail were evident as it slowly made its way across the garden.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being slow or delayed in progress or development.
meanings.sent1: The laggardnesses of the plant growth indicated a need for more sunlight.
meanings.sent2: His laggardnesses in learning new skills made him feel frustrated.
meanings.sent3: The laggardnesses of the clock amused the children as they watched it tick slowly.
meanings.sent4: The laggardnesses of the river's flow mirrored the slow pace of life in the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The laggardnesses of the internet connection tested everyone's patience during the video call.
